DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text name of agent or procedure that is not part of the protocol regimen, and is generally used for treatment of preexisting conditions or symptoms, and for adverse events.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Agent Or Concomitant Procedure Administration Name
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol._Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time._A particular course of action intended to achieve a result._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Concomitant Agent Or Concomitant Procedure Administration
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Concomitant; following as a consequence.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol's complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text names of agents and procedures that are not part of the protocol regimen.  Concomitant agents and procedures are used for treatment of preexisting conditions or symptoms, and for adverse events. [Manually-curated]_

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.
